alert.note: Alert for Ashtabula; Lake (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 8:29PM EDT until August 22 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Ashtabula and Lake. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ashtabula, Conneaut, Geneva-On-The-Lake, Geneva, Madison, North Kingsville, Perry, Austinburg, Kingsville, North Perry, Plymouth Center, Edgewood, Kelloggsville and North Madison. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
